tournament.name: Grand Prix Quebec City 2015 - Trial Winners

decks.notes: The main focus of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Seeker of the Way and Hangarback Walker, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Duress and Stasis Snare. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Utter End and Silkwrap, while gaining card advantage with draw spells like Read the Bones. The deck also has some lifegain elements with cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Shambling Vent to help stay in the game against other aggressive decks.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing powerful creatures such as Siege Rhino, Anafenza, and Hangarback Walker. The deck is able to maintain board presence and apply pressure with cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Warden of the First Tree. Dromoka's Command and Abzan Charm provide versatile removal and utility options, while Den Protector allows for card advantage and recursion. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color combination, providing consistency in casting spells and ensuring a strong early game presence.

The main concept of this deck is to generate advantage by sacrificing creatures and triggering effects that benefit from those sacrifices. By utilizing cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent while also gaining value from sacrificing creatures. Liliana, Heretical Healer serves as a key piece in this strategy, potentially transforming into a powerful planeswalker. With a mix of removal spells, token generators, and mana fixing lands, the deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a relentless and aggressive Aristocrats-style playstyle.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm opponents quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing a low mana curve and efficient damage output. By playing a combination of fast creatures like Zurgo Bellstriker and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Wild Slash and Titan's Strength, the deck aims to deal significant damage early on in the game. The deck also includes pump spells like Become Immense and Temur Battle Rage to increase the damage output of its creatures and finish off opponents swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and creature threats. By utilizing cards like Planar Outburst, Stasis Snare, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, the deck can effectively answer opponent's threats while developing its own board presence with cards like Hangarback Walker and Wingmate Roc. The mana base is built to support the Bant colors of White, Blue, and Green, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring a consistent mana curve throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board early on with removal spells and then overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures such as Mantis Rider and Dragonmaster Outcast. Using cards like Dig Through Time and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to ensure card advantage and consistent threats, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with spells like Crackling Doom and Utter End. By combining aggression with disruption, this Jeskai Aggro deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost spells to fill the graveyard and fuel Treasure Cruise, while using aggressive creatures like Monastery Mentor and Seeker of the Way to push damage. The deck also includes control elements like Dispel and Jeskai Charm to protect the board and disrupt opponents. The combination of cheap removal spells like Fiery Impulse and potential card advantage from Jace, Vryn's Prodigy allows the deck to maintain pressure while controlling the game. Dragonmaster Outcast and Dragonlord Silumgar provide powerful late-game threats to close out games.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells while maintaining control of the board with removal and counterspells. With a mix of powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, along with versatile spells like Crackling Doom and Kolaghan's Command, the deck is able to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By efficiently deploying threats and answers, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board and applying pressure through efficient creatures like Mantis Rider and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The inclusion of cards like Crackling Doom and Fiery Impulse helps to deal with opposing threats while cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Dig Through Time provide card advantage. Ojutai's Command allows for flexibility in gaining life, countering spells, or bringing back a creature from the graveyard. The mana base is designed to support the diverse color requirements of the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures such as Deathmist Raptor, Warden of the First Tree, and Hangarback Walker to put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Vastwood Seer adds versatility and card advantage to the deck. Den Protector and Hidden Dragonslayer provide recursion and removal options, while cards like Wingmate Roc and Dromoka's Command help solidify board position and protect key threats. The deck also includes a mix of efficient removal spells and land cards to support the aggressive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful planeswalkers. By utilizing cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Hangarback Walker, along with support from cards like Dromoka's Command and Wingmate Roc, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Den Protector and Deathmist Raptor provide resilience and additional card advantage to maintain momentum throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also providing ways to protect and strengthen those creatures. It utilizes a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Vastwood Seer with efficient creatures like Warden of the First Tree and Den Protector. The deck also includes removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Valorous Stance to deal with opposing threats. By curving out with strong creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to take control of the board and finish the game swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures such as Avatar of the Resolute and Wingmate Roc, while also using powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Vastwood Seer to generate value and maintain board presence. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent offense, backed up by utility spells like Dromoka's Command and removal like Silkwrap and Stasis Snare. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to ensure the deck can play its threats on curve.
